build.createDescription: Create your assistant by describing roles and tasks
build.nextDescription: Assistant can call multiple skills and tools
build.searchAssistant: Search for the assistant you need
build.manageAssistant: Manage your assistant on this page, including online and offline activities, editing, and more
build.whatWant: What is the role of an assistant and what specific tasks do you want to complete?
build.exampleOne: You are XX, with XX experience, skilled in XX, ...
build.exampleTwo: Your task is XX, and you need to follow the following steps to execute it:
build.automaticallyConfigurations: Automatically select relevant configurations for you
build.prompt: Provide a detailed and specific description of the interaction between the assistant and the user, such as the assistant's identity, specific methods and steps for completing tasks, tone of voice when answering questions, and what issues should be noted
build.assistantMessageFormat: The assistant will send this message at the beginning of each conversation, supports Markdown format
build.maximumPromptLength: The remarks can be up to 1000 characters
build.recommendQuestionsForUsers: Provide recommended questions for users to guide them to ask. When there are more than 3, 3 will be randomly selected.
build.autoCallDescription: Retrieve and recall the added knowledge base in every conversation.
build.onDemandCallDescription: Prompt to call the RecallKnowledge (copyable) method in the assistant's profile (prompt words), and only retrieve the knowledge base when needed.
build.skillDescription: Implement complex and stable business process orchestration through a visual interface, such as project planning and report analysis.
build.nameMaxLength: Name can have at most 50 characters
build.descMaxLength: Description can have at most 1000 characters
build.enterName: Enter a name for the assistant
build.enterDesc: Introduce assistant functionality, visible in conversations and assistant pages
build.forBetter: For better assistant effect, the description needs to be greater than 20 words
build.forExample: For example, the identity of an assistant, specific methods and steps for completing tasks, tone of voice when answering questions, and what issues to pay attention to, etc

errors.selectAtLeastOneWordType: At least one word type must be selected

build.contentSecurityDesc: Review session content for safety with a sensitive word list or API
build.useNewlineToSeparate: Use newline to separate, each line one item
build.defaultAutoReply: Enter the auto-reply content for when the safety review is triggered, e.g., 'The current conversation content violates relevant regulations, please modify and re-enter.'

api.sdkNote: You can use the ChatOpenAI component from OpenAI's official SDK to use the assistant (only parameters in the document are supported. Others like n, top_p, max_tokens in the official component are not supported).
api.messageList: The list of messages included in the conversation so far. 'system' type is not supported, the assistant's own prompt is used for system messages.
api.temperature: Sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Non-zero values will override assistant settings.
api.stream: Default is false. If set, it will send incremental parts of messages like in ChatGPT. The flag will stream events as data-only server-sent events, ending with data: [DONE].
api.skillInput: The question input for the entire skill. The specific keys in the JSON are related to the skill itself and may not all be query keys
api.singleInput: When there is only one input node, id can be omitted
api.historyCount: For skills that support memory, select several historical messages for multi-turn Q&A, default is 10
api.sessionRemark: Each time the API is called, if session_id is passed in, the same id will be returned. If not passed, a new session id will be generated
api.tweaks: Control for each component, allowing you to override input parameters of components
api.tweaksRemark: If no specific component parameters are passed, this can be omitted
api.exampleComponent: Example of OpenAI component configuration in the skill, key is component name {component}-{id}
api.defaultConfig: If {} is empty, default values will be used
api.componentParams: Parameters for each component in the skill can be passed through the API. If not passed, default configurations will be used
api.sessionIdReturn: Session ID used to match input
api.llmAnswer: LLM content returned by the skill
api.dynamicKey: Key defined by the component in the skill. The output is consistent with 'answer', but the key is not fixed
api.specifyKnowledgeBase: To specify a knowledge base for Q&A, pass the knowledge base id in the parameters, e.g.:
api.step1: step1: Confirm the dependencies to trigger the skill
api.dependenciesDescription: Dependencies correspond to the content in the lower left form when creating a session in the interface, and the components used during skill editing
api.uploadFiles: In this example, two files are passed as input:
api.noLoginLinkDescription: The login-free link can be used without logging in, and is only accessible when enable_guest_access = True is configured
api.loginLinkDescription: The login-required link must be used after logging in
api.copyLinkToBrowser: Copy the link and open it in the browser
api.embedCodeDescription: Embed the following code into your website

dataset.name: Dataset Name
dataset.maxDataSetNameLength: Dataset name must be no more than 30 characters
